getResultKey().Description: Get the key that the result of this input will be set in from the Bundle returned by @B_android#support#v4#app#RemoteInput#getResultsFromIntent_E@ when the @B_android#app#PendingIntent_E@ is sent.

Parameters: Intent: The intent object that fired in response to an action or content intent which also had one or more remote input requested.
getResultsFromIntent(android.content.Int.Description: Get the remote input text results bundle from an intent. The returned Bundle will contain a key/value for every result key populated by remote input collector. Use the @B_android#os#Bundle#getCharSequence_E@ method to retrieve a value. For data results use @B_android#support#v4#app#RemoteInput#getDataResultsFromIntent_E@.

isDataOnly().Description: Returns true if the input only accepts data, meaning @B_android#support#v4#app#RemoteInput#getAllowFreeFormInput_E@ is false, @B_android#support#v4#app#RemoteInput#getChoices_E@ is null or empty, and {@link #getAllowedDataTypes is non-null and not empty.

getChoices().Description: Get possible input choices. This can be null if there are no choices to present.

getLabel().Description: Get the label to display to users when collecting this input.

getExtras().Description: Get additional metadata carried around with this remote input.

getAllowFreeFormInput().Description: Get whether or not users can provide an arbitrary value for input. If you set this to false, users must select one of the choices in @B_android#support#v4#app#RemoteInput#getChoices_E@. An @B_java#lang#IllegalArgumentException_E@ is thrown if you set this to false and @B_android#support#v4#app#RemoteInput#getChoices_E@ returns null or empty.
